items.title: Add types to CreateStoreOptions
items.body:
CreateStoreOptions doesn't have types added to the properties. Please add types to them so intelisense can work better.

```
export interface CreateStoreOptions {
    rootReducer,
    repository,
    middlewares?,
    persistedState?
}
```

items.title: Add redux devtools by default or a way to add that to the createSensenetStore
items.body:
Right now there is no way to add [redux-devtools](https://github.com/zalmoxisus/redux-devtools-extension) to the store.

    const store = createStore(
        options.rootReducer,
        {},
        applyMiddleware(...middlewareArray),
    )

redux-devtools should wrap the `applyMiddleware()` method.

items.title: Query with sorting doesn't work
items.body:
Query expression
```ts
query: new Query(q => q.typeIs<LeisureArticle>(LeisureArticle).sort('PublishDate')).toString()
```

Generated result:
```
TypeIs:LeisureArticle .REVERSESORT:'PublishDate'
```

Expected result(without quotes):
```
TypeIs:LeisureArticle .REVERSESORT:PublishDate
```

The server responded with:
```json
{
  "error": {
    "code": "NotSpecified",
    "exceptiontype": "ParserException",
    "message": {
      "lang": "en-us",
      "value": "Unexpected  ) , (query:  +(TypeIs:LeisureArticle .SORT: PublishDate ) +(InTree: /Root/Sites/LeisureWeb/Ismertetők ) ) [Line: 1, Col: 44]"
    },
    "innererror": {
      "trace": "ODataException: Unexpected ')', (query: \"+(TypeIs:LeisureArticle .SORT:'PublishDate') +(InTree:'/Root/Sites/LeisureWeb/Ismertetők')\") [Line: 1, Col: 44]\r\n\r\n---- Inner Exception:\r\nParserException: Unexpected ')', (query: \"+(TypeIs:LeisureArticle .SORT:'PublishDate') +(InTree:'/Root/Sites/LeisureWeb/Ismertetők')\") [Line: 1, Col: 44]\r\n   at SenseNet.Search.Querying.Parser.CqlParser.ParseUnaryTermExp() in E:\\BuildAgent\\_work\\63\\s\\src\\Search\\Querying\\Parser\\CqlParser.cs:line 342\r\n   at SenseNet.Search.Querying.Parser.CqlParser.ParseTermExp() in E:\\BuildAgent\\_work\\63\\s\\src\\Search\\Querying\\Parser\\CqlParser.cs:line 284\r\n   at items.title: SnNotSupportedException: SnLinq: ContentSet.Execute<TResult>
```
items.body:
We use queries like this with our project:
`SenseNet.ContentRepository.Content containerContent = SenseNet.ContentRepository.Content.All.FirstOrDefault(c => c.InTree(PortalContext.Current.Site.Path) && c.Type("ProjectContainer"));`

It'd worked safe and sound but after we've upgraded sn services from 7.0.2 to 7.1.1 the following exception appeared:
```
SnNotSupportedException: SnLinq: ContentSet.Execute<TResult>
   at SenseNet.ContentRepository.Linq.ContentSet`1.Execute[TResult](Expression expression) in E:\BuildAgent\_work\63\s\src\ContentRepository\Linq\ContentSet.cs:line 205
```

items.title: Do not index unused fields
items.body: Indexing should be switched off when a field belongs a not used feature. For example IsRateable, RateStr, RateAvg, RateCount, Rate.

items.title: Scenario field is not indexed correctly
items.body:
This field writes terms like this:
- listitem;exploreactions;manageviewslistitem

**Expected**: discrete names.

**Investigation**: handled by the ShortText that uses LowerStringIndexHandler. It seems useful to write a new field index handler: CommaSeparatedFieldIndexHandler that can provide separated/trimmed tokens.

items.title: Remove Entity Framework dependency.
items.body:
In the StorageContext class, there is a solution of an old (maybe irrelevant) solution of an Entity Framework problem ([see the line in the source](https://github.com/SenseNet/sensenet/blob/b25568628242b4d705910938d50486abd327c92b/src/Storage/StorageContext.cs#L43)). Because of this, we need to keep the Entity Framework dependency (maybe unnecessarily).

The better solution: remove the Entity Framework dependency from the sensenet main component and use only where it is needed (e.g. SenseNet.Security).

items.title: JWT Access Token network latency handling
items.body:
JWT access tokens have a discrete expiration timestamp that is used on both backend and frontend. There are some scenarios when it can be an issue that at the time of sending the request the access token is valid but will be refused by the backend when afterwards due one of the following reasons:
 - Small, frequent calls with CORS preflight requests (e.g. chunked uploads, viewer image loads)
 - Warmup requests
 - Poor network connection with high latency

One possible solution can be an additional *tolerance* parameter for the **access token** on the backend that *extends* the acceptance of the token with a discrete amount of time (e.g. a few secs). We should talk about that.

items.title: Convert EF security data provider to .Net Standard?
items.body:
To convert the project to .net standard, we have to deal with the **Entity Framework** dependency.

Stuff to read:
- https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ef/efcore-and-ef6/porting/
- https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ef/efcore-and-ef6/features

#### Options
- **modify the current project** to use *EF Core* (that supports NetStandard 2.0)
- keep the current project on *.Net Framework* and create a **new project** (*SenseNet.Security.EFCoreSecurityStore*) that uses EF Core.
- **remove** EF dependency (or create a new project) and substitue it with custom SQL.

items.title: Allow starting the repository with new libraries
items.body:
Currently a component's dll version has to be **the same** as the component version in the repository (Packages table) - otherwise the repository will not start.

> This applies and will continue to apply only for _Release_ mode libraries.

We want to allow _lightweight_ releases, when the database has not changed (no schema and no content change) **only the code has changed** to be compatible with the previous component version in the db. 

### Example
##### Component releases
These releases all have a corresponding NuGet package with the same version.

|Component| Version | DB change|Dependency|
|:-----|:----:|:------:|---|
|CompA|7.1.0|YES||
|CompA|7.1.1|-||
|CompA|7.1.2|-||
|CompA|7.2.0|YES||
|CompB|3.2.0|YES||
|CompB|3.2.1|-||
|CompB|3.2.2|-|CompA v7.2.0|
|CompB|3.3.0|YES|CompA v7.2.0|

##### Installed versions (Packages table)

| Component | Version |
|:-------------|:---------------------:|
| CompA | 7.1.0 |
| CompA | 7.1.1 |
| CompB | 3.2.0 |

#### Scenario1
Install NuGet package in Visual Studio: `CompA, 7.1.2`
> **Result**: no error, CompA dll 7.1.2 is compatible with db 7.1.0 (there was no db change since then)

#### Scenario2
Install NuGet package: `CompA, 7.2.0`
> **Result**: ERROR, CompA dll 7.2.0 is NOT compatible with db 7.1.1 (there was a db change)
> _Please execute a patch for CompA._

#### Scenario3
Install NuGet package: `CompB, 3.2.1`
> **Result**: no error, CompB dll 3.2.1 is compatible with db 3.2.0 (there was no db change)

#### Scenario4
Install NuGet package: `CompB, 3.2.2` --> this installs CompA 7.2.0 NuGet package, see dependency above
> **Result**: ERROR, CompA 7.2.0 is not installed yet, see _Scenario2_
> _Please execute a patch for CompA._

items.title: Convert the Tools project to a .Net Standard library
items.body:
Convert the current project to a .Net Standard library.

- [x] tests should work
- [x] the library can be referenced from a _.Net Framework_ and a _.Net Core_ project
- [x] a new package build should create a new nuget package, containing a single library that targets _netstandard2.0_

items.title: [Testing] Modernize tests
items.body: Currently many tests in this repository expect an accessible sensenet instance on localhost. Make tests independent and executable in memory locally, without a service dependency.

items.title: Post/patch sn6sn7
items.body: Do not publish this post until we release the official upgrade package.

items.title: Release a new Security component version
items.body:
- [ ] raise version numbers in projects that have changed since the last release
- [ ] update the _RabbitMQ message provider_ nuspec file to reference the new version

items.title: RabbitMQ message provider
items.body:
- generalize thread-based message processing code in a base class
- implement a new message provider over RabbitMQ
- replace local Tools library reference with a correct NuGet package reference.

items.title: Loading settings in elevated mode
items.body:
Currently we populate the settings tree cache in the name of the current user, which is invalid, because sometimes that user does not have enough permissions for _all the content to load_.

All (?) tree caches should be loaded in **elevated mode**, in a `SystemAccount` block.

#### Solution options
1. elevate in the base TreeCache class (singleton Instance property)
2. elevate in the LoadItems implementations in derived classes

#### Acceptance
- [x] backport to SN6 and notify the CF team

items.title: NullReference exception in TreeCache
items.body:
In some cases (under a heavy load, when workspaces are created in parallel and the settings cache gets invalidated many times) a nullreference exception is thrown in the _TreeCache_ class ([link-to-line](https://github.com/SenseNet/sensenet/blob/7aef9cf685ccfa30e8c599c7f8f48f779f332bfd/src/ContentRepository/TreeCache.cs#L122)), when accessing the singleton Instance.

#### Possible cause
The internal variable may become null because the invalidation in the _InvalidatePrivate_ method happens **outside of a lock block**.

#### Solution options
1. simplify the code using a Lazy variable (_preferred_)
2. or lock the invalidation too

#### Acceptance

- [x] backport to SN6 and notify the CF team

items.title: Add new method for configuring the repo in app start.
items.body: - [x] documentation

items.title: Configure repository start
Update the owner during node save only if it is the visitor.
items.body: If the owner has been changed in the upper layer (meaning it is not set to the Visitor), we should _not_ override it when saving a new node.

items.title: Patch/foreachstep separator
items.body: Add a new capability to the ForEach snadmin step: work with an explicit file list.

items.title: Patching in the cloud
items.body:
The current _SnAdmin_ tool will not be sufficient in a cloud environment. We should discuss the pros and cons of the different options for patching in the cloud.

#### Considerations
- web folders and db are updated differently than in an on-premise solution
- we do not have access to the actual web folder in the cloud, we can patch only the dev machine. After that the developer will _publish_ the new web folder to the staging and live environments.
- currently old and new dlls and the content repository can be 'incompatible' in many ways (old/new CTDs, missing handlers or other dlls) - can we _reduce the chance_ of this so that old and new app domains can connect to the _same database_?

items.title: SnTrace providers
items.body:
Currently we write trace messages to the file system. In a cloud environment this is not the best solution. We should keep the file system writer as the default, but let 3rd party developers create custom providers.

- [x] refactor the current solution to an independent package: **SnFileSystemTraceProvider**
- [x] create a new built-in trace provider that writes to the console: **SnConsoleTraceProvider**
- [x] documentation

A new cloud-friendly provider that sends messages to a _remote service_ is a separate issue.
